array.name: colors
array.item: Q(t2) - Young terraces
Q(t1) - Old terraces
Q(v) - Basaltic lawa flows
QPl(1) - Lacustrine deposits (sand, silt and clay)
QPl(c) - Conglomobrate and marl
Ng(c) - Red coglomerate and sandy conglomerate
Ng(t) - Andesite to trachyand esite flows with parly cone like structure
Ng(i) - Ignimbrite
Ng(i) - Ignimbrite
M(s) - Sandstone, siltstone,amrl and thin bedded fossiliferous limstone
M(m)- Gypsiferous marl , marly limstone and gypsum
M(c) - Red conglomerate and marl
rh - Rhyolitic dome
E(pa) - Andesitic basalt, pyroxene andeste
E(t) - Trachyandesite to trachytoe bearing pseudomorphosed analcime
E(d) - Dacite to rhyodacite tuff,ignimbrite
E(b) - Olivine basalt ,basaltic andesite ,pyroxene bearing andesite
E(l) - Nummulitic limstone , calcareous tuff
E(v2) - Volcanosedimentary rocks ,andesite and dacitice lavas, limstone lenses
E(a) - Megaporphyritic to porphyritic andesite and trachyandestie
E(v1) - Volcanosedimentary rocks,andesite and daciic lavas
E(P) - Tuff breccia , ignimbrite and subordinate peroxene andesite to trchvandesite
PE(c)- Violet volcanosedimantryconglomerate and breccia
PE(v) - Volcanosedimentary rocks , porphyritic andesite , trachyandesite associated with basic dykes .
PE(m) - Gypsiferous marl, calcareous sandstone and thin bedded limestone.
K(m)(2) - Silty shale ,marl and limestone
K(1)(2) - Micritic limestone with basal conglomerate
K(v2)(2) - Porphyritic andesites, olivine basalt associated with pyroclastic rocks. And K(v1)(1) - Acidic tuff intercalated with shale and some basic volcanics.
gr(k) - Khan khandi biotite granite to granodiorite
gr(a) - Anzan alkhali granite to horn blande biotite granodiorite
sn(r) - Razgah monzodiorite bearing pseudoleucite
